info.title: Box Platform 2.0 APIs
info.description: The Box Content API gives you access to secure content management and content experience features for use in your own app. It strives to be RESTful and is organized around the main resources you’re familiar with from the Box web interface.

get.description:
Authorize a user by sending them through [Box](https://box.com).

To begin the process of authenticating user and authorizing your
application to work with the Box APIs, you will need to send a
user to a URL with this format.

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description:
The string value `"code"` is the only current value we support
for the OAuth2 grant type.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description:
The Client ID of the application that is requesting to authenticate
the user. To get the Client ID for your application, log in to your
Box developer console and click the **Edit Application** link for
the application you're working with. In the OAuth2 Parameters section
of the configuration page, find the item labeled **client_id**. The
text of that item is your application's Client ID.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description:
The URL to which Box redirects the browser after the user has granted
or rejected the application permission. This URL must match the
redirect URL in the configuration of your application. It must be a
valid HTTPS URL and it needs to be able to handle the redirection to
complete the next step in the OAuth2 flow.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description:
A custom string of your choice. Box will pass the same string to
the redirect URL when authentication is complete. This parameter
can be used to identify a user on redirect, as well as protect
against hijacked sessions and other attacks.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of application scopes you'd like to
authenticate the user for. This defaults to all the scopes configured
for the application in its configuration page.

post.description:
Request an Access Token using either client-side obtained OAuth2
authorization code or a JWT assertion.

An access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a
request belongs to an authorized session. In the normal order of operations
you will begin by requesting authentication from the Box authorize endpoint
and Box will send you an authorization code. You will then send this code
to this endpoint to exchange it for an access token.

The returned Access Token can then be used to to make Box API calls.

This is the URL of the Box revoke endpoint, the endpoint that revokes access
tokens, or to put it another way, the endpoint that ends sessions, logging
users out.

200.description: The access token has been revoked

get.description:
Retrieves the full metadata about a folder, including information about when
it was last updated as well as some of the files and folders contained in it.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the folder to fetch. The root folder of a Box account is
always represented by the id "0".

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The folder attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description:
A full folder object is returned, including the most current information
available about it.

401.description: 4xx if the user does not have access to it.

404.description: An 404 error is thrown if the folder does not exist.

put.summary: Update Folder, Create Shared Link, Create or Delete
put.description:
Used to update information about the folder. To move a folder, update the ID
of its parent. To enable an email address that can be used to upload files to
this folder, update the folder_upload_email attribute. An optional If-Match
header can be included to ensure that client only updates the folder if it
knows about the latest version.


Used to create a shared link for this particular folder. Please see here for
more information on the permissions available for shared links. In order to
get default shared link status, set it to an empty access level, i.e.
`{"shared_link": {}}`. In order to disable a shared link, send this same type
of `PUT` request with the value of shared_link set to null, i.e.
`{"shared_link": null}`


To add or remove an item from a collection, you do a PUT on that item and
change the list of collections it belongs to. Philosophically, this is similar
to the way "move" operations work on files and folders - you do a `PUT` on the
item and change its parent. It’s the same idea with collections, except you’re
changing which collection(s) the item belongs to instead of the folder it
belongs to. Currently the only collection available is the favorites
collection, and you’ll need to know it’s ID for the user that is making the
API call, since every user has a different favorites collection_id.

The Add/Remove API handling will check all ids passed in before performing any
add/removal operations. If any collection ids are malformed or do not exist in
the user’s account, the API call will throw a 400. Only if all of the
collection ids are valid will the adds and removals be carried out.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the folder to update. The root folder of a Box account is
always represented by the id "0".

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: This is in the `etag` field of the folder object.

name.description: The desired name for the folder

sync_state.description:
Whether Box Sync clients will sync this folder. Values
of `synced` or` not_synced` can be sent.

can_non_owners_invite.description:
If this parameter is set to false, only folder owners and
co-owners can send collaborator invites

is_collaboration_restricted_to_enterpris.description:
Whether to restrict future collaborations to within the
enterprise. Does not affect existing collaborations.

id.description: The ID of the parent folder

access.description:
The level of access. Can be `open` ("People with the link"),
`company` ("People in your company"), or `collaborators`
("People in this folder").

If you omit this field then the access level will be set to
the default access level specified by the enterprise admin.

password.description:
The password required to access the shared link. Set to null
to remove the password.

unshared_at.description:
The date-time that this link will become disabled. This field
can only be set by users with paid accounts.

can_download.description:
Whether the shared link allows downloads. For shared links
on folders, this also applies to any items in the folder.
Can only be set with access levels `open` and `company`
(not `collaborators`).

id.description: The ID of the user (should be your own user ID)

tags.description:
The tags to attach this folder. To add/remove a tag to/from a
folder, you can first get the folder’s current tags, then modify
the list as required. Finally, set the folder’s entire list of
tags.

201.description:
When 'collections' is specified in body the folder is moved into
collection with the ID

delete.description:
Used to delete a folder. A recursive parameter must be included in order to
delete folders that have items inside of them. An optional If-Match header can
be included to ensure that client only deletes the folder if it knows about
the latest version.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the folder to delete. The root folder of a Box account is
always represented by the id "0".

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.description: Whether to delete this folder if it has items inside of it.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: This is in the `etag` field of the folder object.

204.description: An empty 204 response will be returned upon successful deletion.

400.description:
An error is thrown if the folder is not empty and the ‘recursive’
parameter is not included.

get.description:
Retrieves the files and/or folders contained within this folder without any
other metadata about the folder. Any attribute in the full files or folders
objects can be passed in with the fields parameter to get specific attributes,
and only those specific attributes back; otherwise, the mini format is
returned for each item by default.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: The ID of the folder to fetch items for

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: File/folder attribute(s) to include for the items returned

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
The offset at which to begin the response. An offset of value of 0 will
start at the beginning of the folder-listing. Note that if there are
hidden items in your previous response, your next offset should be the
offset plus the limit, not the number of records you received back.

200.description: A collection of items contained in the folder is returned.

post.description:
Used to create a new empty folder. The new folder will be created inside of
the specified parent folder

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

name.description: The desired name for the folder

id.description: The ID of the parent folder

201.description:
A full folder object is returned if the parent folder ID is valid and if
no name collisions occur.

post.description:
Used to create a copy of a folder in another folder. The original version of
the folder will not be altered.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: The ID of the folder to copy

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

name.description: An optional new name for the folder

id.description: The ID of the destination folder

201.description:
A full folder object is returned if the ID is valid and if the update is
successful.

409.description:
If the intended destination folder is the same, as this will cause a name
collision.

get.description:
Use this to get a list of all the collaborations on a folder i.e. all of the
users that have access to that folder.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: The ID of the folder to get collaborations for

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The maximum number of items to return in a page. The default is 100 and
the max is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The item at which to begin the response

200.description:
A collection of collaboration objects are returned. If there are no
collaborations on this folder, an empty collection will be returned.

scopes.root_readonly: Read all files and folders stored in Box
scopes.root_readwrite: Read and write all files and folders stored in Box
scopes.manage_webhook: Create webhooks programmatically through the API

AccessToken.description: A token that can be used to make authenticated API calls

expires_in.description: The time in seconds in seconds by which this token will expire.

token_type.description: The type of access token returned.

refresh_token.description:
The refresh token for this access token, which can be used
to request a new access token when the current one expires.

issued_token_type.description:
The type of downscoped access token returned. This is only
returned if an access token has been downscoped.

restricted_to.description:
The permissions that this access token permits,
providing a list of resources (files, folders, etc)
and the scopes permitted for each of those resources.

status.description: The HTTP status of the response.

help_url.description: A URL that links to more information about why the error occurred.

message.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

Collaboration.description:
Collaborations define access permissions for users and groups to files and
folders, similar to access control lists. A collaboration object grants a
user or group access to a file or folder with permissions defined by a
specific role.

id.description: The ID of the collaboration object

allOf.description: The file or folder that access is granted to
The user or group that is granted access

invite_email.description:
The email address used to invite an unregistered collaborator, if
they are not a registered user.

can_view_path.description:
Whether the "view path collaboration" feature is enabled or not. View
path collaborations allow the invitee to see the entire parent path to
the item. View path collaboration does not grant privileges in any
parent folder (e.g. cannot see content the user is not collaborated
on), other than the permission to view the parent path.

status.description: The status of the collaboration invitation.

acknowledged_at.description:
When the `status` of the collaboration object changed to
`accepted` or `rejected`

allOf.description: The user who created the collaboration object

created_at.description: When the collaboration object was created

modified_at.description: When the collaboration object was last modified

Enterprise.description: A representation of a Box enterprise

File.description:
A full representation of a file, as can be returned from any
file API endpoints by default

version_number.description: The version number of this file

comment_count.description: The number of comments on this file

allOf.description:
An object containing the permissions that the current user has
for this item

tags.description: All tags applied to this folder.

allOf.description:
The lock held on this file. If there is no lock, this can either
be `null` or have a timestamp in the past.

extension.description:
Indicates the suffix, when available, on the file. By default,
set to an empty string. The suffix usually indicates the encoding
(file format) of the file contents or usage.

is_package.description: Whether the file is a package. Used for Mac Packages used by iWorks.

expiring_embed_link.description:
An expiring URL for an embedded preview session in an iframe.
This URL will expire after 60 seconds and the session will
expire after 60 minutes.

allOf.description: Information about the watermarking on this file

allowed_invitee_roles.description:
Folder [collaboration](#collaboration-object) roles allowed by the
enterprise administrator.

is_externally_owned.description: Whether this file is owned by a user outside of the enterprise.

has_collaborations.description: Whether this file has any collaborators.

additionalProperties.description: The template name for the metadata

File--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a file, as returned from any
file API endpoints by default

sha1.description: The SHA1 hash of the file.

size.description:
The file size in bytes. Be careful parsing this integer, it can
easily go into [exponent notation](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/\
Double-precision_floating-point_format).

path_collection.description: The path of folders to this file, starting at the root

created_at.description: When this file was upload to Box’s servers

modified_at.description: When this file was last updated on the Box servers

trashed_at.description: When this file was last moved to the trash

purged_at.description: When this file will be permanently deleted

content_created_at.description: When this file was created originally

content_modified_at.description: When this file was last updated

expires_at.description: When the file will automatically be deleted

allOf.description: The user who created this file
The user who last modified this file
The user who owns this file

The shared link object for this file. Will be
`null` if no shared link has been created.
The folder that contains this file.

item_status.description:
Whether this item is deleted or not. Values include `active`,
`trashed` if the file has been moved to the trash, and `deleted` if
the file has been permanently deleted

File--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a file, used when
nested under another resource.

sequence_id.description: A unique ID for use with the /events endpoint

etag.description:
The entity tag of this file object. Used with `If-Match`
headers.

FileVersion.description: A full representation of a file version

name.description: The name of the file version

size.description: Size of the file version in bytes

created_at.description: When the file version object was created

modified_at.description: When the file version object was last updated

allOf.description: The user who last updated the file version

id.description: The ID of the file version object

trashed_at.description: When the file version object was trashed.

purged_at.description: When the file version object was purged.

FileVersion--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a file version, used when
nested under another resource.

sha1.description: The SHA1 hash of this file.

Folder.description:
A full representation of a folder, as can be returned from any
folder API endpoints by default

sync_state.description:
Whether this folder will be synced by the Box sync clients or not. Can
be `synced`, `not_synced`, or `partially_synced`.

has_collaborations.description: Whether this folder has any collaborators.

allOf.description:
An object containing the permissions that the current user has
for this item

tags.description: All tags applied to this folder.

can_non_owners_invite.description: Whether non-owners can invite collaborators to this folder.

is_externally_owned.description: Whether this folder is owned by a user outside of the enterprise.

is_collaboration_restricted_to_enterpris.description:
Whether future collaborations should be restricted to within the
enterprise only.

allowed_shared_link_access_levels.description:
Access level settings for shared links set by administrator. Can
include `open`, `company`, or `collaborators`.

allowed_invitee_roles.description:
Folder [collaboration](#collaboration-object) roles allowed by the
enterprise administrator.

allOf.description: Information about the watermarking on this folder

additionalProperties.description: The template name for the metadata

Folder--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a folder, as returned from any
folder API endpoints by default

created_at.description:
The time the folder was created.  May be `null` for some folders such
as root or trash.

size.description:
The folder size in bytes. Be careful parsing this integer, it can
easily go into [exponent notation](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/\
Double-precision_floating-point_format).

path_collection.description: The path of folders to this folder, starting at the root

allOf.description: The user who created this folder
The user who last modified this folder.

trashed_at.description:
The time the folder or its contents were put in the trash. May be
`null` for some folders such as root or trash.

purged_at.description:
The time the folder or its contents will be purged from the trash. May
be `null` for some folders such as root or trash.

content_created_at.description:
The time the folder or its contents were originally created (according
to the uploader).  May be `null` for some folders such as root or
trash.

content_modified_at.description:
The time the folder or its contents were last modified (according to
the uploader).  May be `null` for some folders such as root or trash.

expires_at.description:
When the folder will automatically be deleted, i.e. expired. This
attribute cannot be set.

allOf.description: The user who owns this folder.

The shared link object for this folder. Will be
`null` if no shared link has been created.

access.description: The access level for which the email was created.

email.description: The upload email address for this folder. `null` if not set.

allOf.description:
The folder that contains this folder.

May be `null` for folders such as root, trash and child folders
whose parent is inaccessible.

item_status.description:
Whether this item is deleted or not. Values include `active`,
`trashed` if the item has been moved to the trash, and
`deleted` if the item has been permanently deleted.

item_collection.description: A collection of mini file and folder objects contained in this folder.

Folder--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a file version, used when
nested under another resource.

sequence_id.description:
A unique ID for use with the `/events` endpoint. May be `null` for
some folders, such as root or trash.

etag.description:
The entity tag of this folder object. Used with If-Match
headers. May be `null` for some folders such as root or
trash.

Group.description:
Groups contain a set of users, and can be used in place of
users in some operations, such as collaborations.

provenance.description:
Keeps track of which external source this group is
coming from (e.g. "Active Directory", "Google Groups",
"Facebook Groups").  Setting this will
also prevent Box users from editing the group name
and its members directly via the Box web application.
This is desirable for one-way  syncing of groups.

external_sync_identifier.description:
An arbitrary identifier that can be used by
external group sync tools to link this Box Group to
an external group. Example values of this field
could be an Active Directory Object ID or a Google
Group ID.  We recommend you use of this field in
order to avoid issues when group names are updated in
either Box or external systems.

description.description: Human readable description of the group.
description.example: Support Group - as imported from Active Directory

invitability_level.description:
Specifies who can invite the group to collaborate
on folders (Create Collaboration).

When set to `admins_only` the enterprise admin, co-admins,
and the group's admin can invite the group.

When set to `admins_and_members` all the admins listed
above and group members can invite the group.

When set to `all_managed_users` all managed users in the
enterprise can invite the group.

member_viewability_level.description:
Specifies who can view the members of the group
(Get Memberships for Group).

* `admins_only - the enterprise admin, co-admins, group's
  group admin
* `admins_and_members` - all admins and group members
* `all_managed_users` - all managed users in the
  enterprise

Group--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a group, as returned from any
group API endpoints by default

id.description: The ID of the group object

created_at.description: When the group object was created

modified_at.description: When the group object was last modified

ItemReference.description: A generic mini representation of a file, folder, user or enterprise

sequence_id.description:
A unique ID for use with the `/events` endpoint. May be `null` for
some items, such as root or trash.

etag.description:
The entity tag of this item. Used with If-Match headers.
May be `null` for some folders such as root or trash.

ItemReferenceCollection.description: A list of generic mini representations of a file, folder, user or enterprise

Lock.description: The lock held on a file.

allOf.description: The use who created the lock

created_at.description: The time this lock was created at

expired_at.description: The time this lock is to expire at, which might be in the past

is_download_prevented.description: Whether or not the file can be downloaded while locked

Metadata.description:
The metadata as applied by a metadata template to a file or
folder

$canEdit.description: Whether the user can edit this metadata

$id.description: 36-character UUID to identify the metadata object

$parent.description: An ID for the parent folder

$scope.description:
An ID for the scope in which this template
has been applied

$type.description:
A unique identifier for the "type" of this instance. This is an internal
system property and should not be used by a client application.

$typeVersion.description:
The last-known version of the template of the object. This is an internal
system property and should not be used by a client application.

$version.description:
The version of the metadata object. Starts at 0 and increases every time
a user-defined property is modified.

MetadataCascadePolicy.description:
A cascade policy that applies to metadata policy template
to a folder

id.description: The ID of the metadata cascade policy object

owner_enterprise.description: The enterprise that owns the policy.

id.description: The ID of the enterprise that owns the policy.

parent.description: Represent the folder the policy is applied to

id.description: The ID of the folder the policy is applied to

scope.description:
The scope of the target instance that will be cascaded down. The `scope`
and `templateKey` together identify the metadata on the folder that is
to be cascaded down. Today, only `global` and `enterprise_*` scopes are
supported.

templateKey.description:
The template key of the target metadata template to cascade down.
The `scope` & `templateKey` together identify the metadata on the f
older that is to be cascaded down.

MetadataTemplate.description: A template for metadata as can be applied to files and folders

templateKey.description:
A unique identifier for the template. The identifier must be unique across
the scope of the enterprise to which the metadata template is being
applied.

scope.description:
The scope of the object. `global` and `enterprise_*` scopes are supported.

The `global` scope contains the template with a key of `properties`,
while the enterprise scope pertains to custom templates created within
the enterprise.

 The ID of the enterprise will be appended to the enterprise scope.

displayName.description: The display name of the template

hidden.description: Whether this template is hidden in the UI

fields.description: The ordered set of key:value pairs for the template.

MetadataTemplateField.description:
An ordered set of key-value pairs that are part of a
metadata template

type.description: The data type of the field's value

key.description:
A unique identifier for the field. The identifier must
be unique within the template to which it belongs.

displayName.description: The display name of the field.

hidden.description: Whether this template is hidden in the UI

key.description:
For type `enum` and `multiSelect`, one of the potential values
that can be selected

error.description: The type of the error returned.

error_description.description: The type of the error returned.

Pagination.description: The part of an API response that describes pagination

total_count.description:
One greater than the offset of the last entry in the entire collection.
The total number of entries in the collection may be less than
`total_count`.

limit.description:
The limit that was used for these entries. This will be the same as the
`limit` query parameter unless that value exceeded the maximum value
allowed. The maximum value varies by API.

offset.description:
The 0-based offset of the first entry in this set. This will be the same
as the `offset` query parameter.

order.description: The order by which items are returned

Permissions.description: The part of an API response that describes permissions

can_access.description: Whether the current user can access the item

can_upload.description: Whether the current user can upload to the item

can_rename.description: Whether the current user can rename the item

can_delete.description: Whether the current user can delete the item

can_share.description: Whether the current user can share the item

can_invite_collaborator.description: Whether the current user can invite collaborators to the item

can_set_share_access.description: Whether the current user can set share permissions for the item

Reference.description: The bare basic reference for an object

type.description: The type of object, defaults to `folder`

SharedLink.description:
Shared links provide direct, read-only access to files or folder on Box
using a URL. Shared links with open access level allow anyone with the URL
to access the item, while shared links with company or collaborators access
levels can only be accessed by appropriate authenticated Box users.

url.description:
The URL to access the item on Box.  If entered in a browser, this URL will
display the item in Box's preview UI.  If a custom URL is set this field
will return the custom URL, but the original URL will also continue to
work.

download_url.description:
The "direct Link" URL to download the item.  If entered in a browser, this
URL will trigger a download of the item.  This URL includes the file
extension so that the file will be saved with the right file type.

vanity_url.description:
The "Custom URL" that can also be used to preview the item on Box.  Custom
URLs can only be created or modified in the Box Web application.

access.description:
The access level specified when the shared link was created. Can be `open`
("People with the link"), `company` ("People in your company"), or
`collaborators` ("People in this folder").  When creating a shared link,
if you omit this field then the access level will be set to the default
access level specified by the enterprise admin.

effective_access.description:
The effective access level for the shared link.  This can be lower than
the value in the `access` field if the enterprise settings restrict the
allowed access levels.

unshared_at.description:
The date-time that this link will become disabled. This field can only be
set by users with paid accounts.

is_password_enabled.description: Whether the shared link has a password set

can_download.description:
Whether the shared link allows downloads.  For shared links on
folders, this also applies to any items in the folder. Can only be set
with access levels `open` and `company` (not `collaborators`).

can_preview.description:
Whether the shared link allows previewing.  Always `true`.  For shared
links on folders, this also applies to any items in the folder.

download_count.description: The number of times the item has been downloaded

preview_count.description: The number of times the item has been previewed

TokenRequest.description: A request for a new OAuth2 token

grant_type.description:
The type of request being made, either using a client-side obtained
authorization code, a refresh token, a JWT assertion, or another access
token for the purpose of downscoping a token.

client_id.description:
The Client ID of the application requesting an access token.

Used in combination with `authorization_code` or
`urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer` as the `grant_type`.

client_secret.description:
The client secret of the application requesting an access token.

Used in combination with `authorization_code` or
`urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer` as the `grant_type`.

code.description:
The client-side authorization code passed to your application by
Box in the browser redirect after the user has successfully
granted your application permission to make API calls on their
behalf.

Used in combination with `authorization_code` as the `grant_type`.

refresh_token.description:
A refresh token used to get a new access token with.

Used in combination with `refresh_token` as the `grant_type`.

assertion.description:
A JWT assertion for which to request a new access token.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer`
as the `grant_type`.

subject_token.description:
The token to exchange for a downscoped token. This can be a regular
access token, a JWT assertion, or an app token.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

subject_token_type.description:
The type of `subject_token` passed in.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

actor_token.description:
The actor token used to create an annotator token.
This is a JWT assertion.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

actor_token_type.description:
The type of `actor_token` passed in.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

scope.description:
The space-delimited list of scopes that you want apply to the
new access token.

The `subject_token` will need to have all of these scopes or
the call will error with **401 Unauthorized**.

resource.description: Full URL for the file that the token should be generated for.

TokenRevocationRequest.description: A request to revoke an OAuth2 token

client_id.description:
The Client ID of the application requesting to revoke the
access token.

client_secret.description:
The client secret of the application requesting to revoke
an access token.

User.description:
A full representation of a user, as can be returned from any
user API endpoints by default

tracking_codes.description: An array of key/value pairs set by the user’s admin

can_see_managed_users.description: Whether the user can see other enterprise users in her contact list

is_sync_enabled.description: Whether the user can use Box Sync

is_external_collab_restricted.description:
Whether the user is allowed to collaborate with users outside her
enterprise

is_exempt_from_device_limits.description: Whether to exempt the user from Enterprise device limits

is_exempt_from_login_verification.description: Whether the user must use two-factor authentication

allOf.description: Representation of the user’s enterprise

my_tags.description:
Tags for all files and folders owned by the user. Values returned
will  only contain tags that were set by the requester.

hostname.description:
The root (protocol, subdomain, domain) of any links that need to be
generated for the user

is_platform_access_only.description: Whether the user is an App User

User--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a user, as returned from any
user API endpoints by default

created_at.description: When the user object was created

modified_at.description: When the user object was last modified

space_amount.description: The user’s total available space amount in bytes

space_used.description: The amount of space in use by the user

max_upload_size.description: The maximum individual file size in bytes the user can have

avatar_url.description: URL of the user’s avatar image

User--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a user, used when
nested under another resource.

id.description: The ID of the user object

login.description: The email address the user uses to log in

WatermarkInfo.description: The watermark information about this item

is_watermarked.description: Whether the item is watermarked or not.
